text:
Sonia sat beside Raskolnikov, glancing at him. 

Katerina Ivanovna spoke sharply, “Not like your draggletails! My father wouldn’t take them as cooks.” 

The commissariat clerk gulped vodka. “Yes, he drank!” 

Katerina Ivanovna snapped, “He was kind and honorable! He trusted the wrong people.” 

“Did you say a cock?” the clerk shouted. 

Katerina sighed, lost in thought.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Katerina Ivanovna defends her late husband’s character, emphasizing his kindness and love for his family despite his drinking problem.
